Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-8 coated capillary showed strong ability to sieve linear alkanes from branched alkane isomers.
ZIF-8 coated capillary excluded branched alkane isomers during separation.
The material exhibited size-exclusion effect towards large-sized proteins, eliminating their interference during peptide enrichment.
Low-coordinated Zn2+ ions on the surface of ZIF-8 chelated with histidine residues in low-abundance peptides, enabling their efficient enrichment.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with specific interactions (e.g., Zn2+-histidine chelation)

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: BSA tryptic digest sequence coverage increased from 12% to 47%; HSA tryptic digest sequence coverage increased from 17% to 38%; detection limit for BSA tryptic digest: 0.001 Î¼g

Other Information.Additional Info: The material demonstrated excellent hydrophilicity and magnetic responsiveness, allowing efficient handling in aqueous solutions and quick separation using an external magnetic field.
